intro: Laterifissum, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants typically have basal leaves that are heart-shaped or arrowhead-shaped, and they produce small, clustered flowers in shades of white, pink, or purple. They are often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Some species of Laterifissum are considered ornamental due to their attractive foliage and flowers.
